platform.model

Class Platform

  • java.lang.Object
    • platform.model.Platform

  • public class Platform
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Hardware Platform model. A platform consists of multiple components such as cluster, network links, DMA, processors etc.
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      All the Clusters of the platform.

        Name of the platform

        Total number of clusters in the platform

        Total number of DMA Engines in the platform

        Total number of processors in the platform

        private Cluster[] clusters
        All the Clusters of the platform.

        private Processor[] processors

        All the network links of the platform.

        All the memories of the platform.

      • dmaEngines

        private DmaEngine[] dmaEngines
        All the DMA Engines of the platform.

      • minDistances

        private int[][] minDistances
        All the distances between processors or clusters of the platform. If there are no clusters in the platform, this array will store distances between the processors of the platform.

      • dmaSetupTime

        private int dmaSetupTime
        Initialization Time required for the DMA.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Platform

        public Platform(java.lang.String name,
        int numClusters,
        int numDmaEngines,
        int numProcessors,
        int numMemories,
        int numLinks)
        Initialize the platform model.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the platform
        numClusters - total number of clusters in the platform
        numDmaEngines - total number of DMAs in the platform
        numProcessors - total number of processors in the platform
        numMemories - total number of memories in the platform
        numLinks - total number of network links in the platform

    • Method Detail

      • getAllClusters

        public java.util.HashSet<Cluster> getAllClusters()
        Gets all the clusters of the platform
        Returns:
        a set of all clusters in the platform

      • sortElements

        public void sortElements()
        We sort the components of the platform according to their ID's This will help to address them using the index variable especially in the API like Processor.getMemory(int)

      • getClusterIndex

        public int getClusterIndex(Cluster cluster)
        Gets index of Cluster in the platform.
        Parameters:
        cluster - Cluster Component
        Returns:
        index in the array of Clusters where this component is present.

      • getProcIndex

        public int getProcIndex(Processor processor)
        Gets index of Processor in the platform.
        Parameters:
        processor - Processor Component
        Returns:
        index in the array of Processors where this component is present.

      • getDmaEngineIndex

        public int getDmaEngineIndex(DmaEngine dmaEngine)
        Gets index of DMA Engine in the platform.
        Parameters:
        dmaEngine - DMA Engine component.
        Returns:
        index in the array of DMA Engines where this component is present.

      • getDistanceMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<int[]>> getDistanceMap()
        Gets the minimum distances between the processors or clusters.
        Returns:
        Distance is the key of the hashmap and the value contains a list of integer array with two value source processor/cluster and destination processor/cluster index. This index is the same index as the arrays of processors/clusters.

      • getMinDistanceInPlatform

        public int getMinDistanceInPlatform()
        Minimum distance in the platform between two processors / clusters.
        Returns:
        Minimum distance between any two processors / clusters

      • getMaxDistanceInPlatform

        public int getMaxDistanceInPlatform()
        Maximum distance in the platform between two processors / clusters.
        Returns:
        Maximum distance between any two processors / clusters

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance(Cluster srcCluster,
                 Cluster dstCluster)
        Gets minimum distance between any two given clusters.
        Parameters:
        srcCluster - source cluster
        dstCluster - destination cluster
        Returns:
        distance between source and destination cluster

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance(int aIndex,
                 int bIndex)
        Get the minimum distance in the array.
        Parameters:
        aIndex - first index
        bIndex - second index
        Returns:
        value minDistances[aIndex][bIndex]

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance(Processor srcProc,
                 Processor dstProc)
        Gets minimum distance between any two given processors. Note : In this case, I assumed that there are zero clusters in the platform.
        Parameters:
        srcProc - source processor
        dstProc - destination processor
        Returns:
        distance between source and destination processor

      • calculateMinDistances

        public void calculateMinDistances()
        Calculate the minimum distances between the clusters. If there are no clusters in the platform it calculates the minimum distances between the processors.

      • validatePlatform

        public void validatePlatform()
        Check if platform model built confirms to specifications in the XML file.

        public int getNumClusters()
        Gets the number of clusters in the platform.
        Returns:
        number of clusters in the platform.
